Plot autocorrelation (and similars) of dataset

Source: R/ggvar_acf.R
ggvar_acf.Rd

ggvar_acf plots the result of a acf call for every series, using facet_wrap. ggvar_ccf plots all the cross correlations (and similars) between the series, using facet_grid.

Usage

ggvar_acf(
  x,
  series = NULL,
  type = "correlation",
  lag.max = NULL,
  ci = 0.95,
  ...,
  geom = "segment",
  args_geom = list(),
  args_ribbon = list(linetype = 2, color = "blue", fill = NA),
  args_hline = list(),
  args_facet = list()
)

ggvar_ccf_grid(
  x,
  series = NULL,
  type = "correlation",
  lag.max = NULL,
  ci = 0.95,
  ...,
  geom = "segment",
  facet = "ggplot",
  args_geom = list(),
  args_ribbon = list(linetype = 2, color = "blue", fill = NA),
  args_hline = list(),
  args_facet = list()
)

ggvar_ccf_ind(x, serie_x, serie_y, ...)

ggvar_ccf_wrap(x, series, ...)

Arguments

x

A dataset (object coercible to data.frame) or a "varest" object to get residuals from.

series

A character vector with variables (column names) to consider. Defaults to all (NULL).

type

The type of ACF to be computed, passed to acf. Can be either "correlation", "covariance", or "partial".

lag.max

The number of lags used to calculate the ACF, passed to acf. defaults to 10 * log(nrow(x) / ncol(x), base = 10).

ci

The level of confidence for the ACF confidence interval. Set to FALSE to omit the geom_ribbon.

...

Additional arguments passed to acf.

geom

The ggplot geom used to create the plot, 'segment' (the default) for geom_segment, 'area' for geom_area.

args_geom

Arguments passed to the chosen geom.

args_ribbon

Aditional arguments passed to geom_ribbon.

args_hline

Aditional arguments passed to geom_hline.

args_facet

Aditional arguments passed to facet_wrap.

facet

The facet "engine" to be used. 'ggplot2' for facet_grid, 'ggh4x' for facet_grid2

serie_x, serie_y

Variables to chose for x and y axis in ggvar_ccf_ind.

Value

An object of class ggplot.

Examples

ggvar_acf(freeny[-2], args_facet = list(scales = "free_y"))

ggvar_ccf_grid(freeny[-2], args_facet = list(scales = "free_y"))

ggvar_acf(vars::VAR(freeny[-2]), args_facet = list(scales = "free_y"))
